paragraphs: Auckland, known as T훮maki Makaurau in M훮ori, is the largest city in New Zealand and one of the most culturally diverse. The region has been inhabited for over 800 years and was originally settled by M훮ori tribes due to its fertile land and strategic location between two harbors.
In 1840, the Treaty of Waitangi was signed, and Auckland became the capital of New Zealand (until 1865). The city quickly expanded due to European settlement and trade.
Today, Auckland is a bustling metropolis known for its iconic Sky Tower, volcanic cones, sailing culture, and vibrant blend of M훮ori, Pacific Islander, and European heritage.
